channel.title: Help with my server---
channel.description:
:eek: :eek: :eek: when i try to open client.class it says --- windows cannot open this file
file: client.class
to open this file, windows needs to know which program created it windows can go online to look it up automaticly or you can manualy select from a list of programs on your computer.
what do you want to do?
[ul][li]use the web service to find the apropriate program[/li] [li]select the program from a list[/li][/ul]
what do i do to open client.class!! please help me!! PLEASE~!

item.title: Help with my server---
item.dc:creator: @Wood_Mime Wood Mime
item.description:
@Wood_Mime wrote:

You need to download the JDK ( Java development kit ) then right click and ‘open with’ and choose notepad, and do that with the other types of files in your source folder. Then they will open in notepad and you can open them. It’s in a sticky in the tut’s forum.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my server---
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

You don’t. It’s a bunch of gibberish created from client.java that the Java Virtual Machine reads into the RuneScape coding. There are de-compilers or what ever but the ones I’ve found don’t work.

Read full topic
